intro: Freziera rufescens, commonly known as the redstem freziera, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Freziera rufescens is an important species in wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
